author: canberratimes.com.au
text:
COMEDY FESTIVAL
DENISE SCOTT and JUDITH LUCY: DISAPPOINTMENTS ★★★½
State Theatre
Until April 22 
Denise Scott and Judith Lucy have been entertaining Melbourne since they were fertile.
SHARE Share on Facebook SHARE Share on Twitter TWEET Link Denise Scott and Judith Lucy's show is a wild, messy mash-up of dry vaginas, arthritis and odd swellings.  Photo: Simon Schluter The long-time collaborators first teamed up in Comedy is Not Pretty in 1999, and again in The Spiral four years ago, in between vastly successful live comedy and TV careers.
Their latest show, Disappointments , is, by Comedy Festival standards, a stadium show. It has multimedia elements, props, and a huge room (the State Theatre), which they packed full on Easter Saturday night.
This show hums along. It's a wild, messy mash-up of dry vaginas, arthritis and odd swellings. I now know rather more than I did about alternative treatments for irritable bowel syndrome.
It's not entirely about ageing womanhood, though. There are cracks at popular psychology ("Who wants to be mindful when you're having a pap smear?") and social media (the show's title riffs on the gap between the "bullshit" we write on Facebook and the reality of our dismal lives).
title: Melbourne Comedy Festival 2017 review: Judith Lucy and Denise Scott's Disappointments
